metadata.title: The microarray technology: facts and controversies

body_text.text: None of the authors of the present manuscript have a commercial or other association that might pose a conflict of interest (e.g. pharmaceutical stock ownership or consultancy). This work was supported in part by a grant for Clinical and Virological research (SFR‐CAP santé/EA‐4684) from the Medical University and School of Medicine of Reims, France.

FIGREF0.text: Figure 1:  Place of microarray technology in virology laboratories: (A) After rapid antigen tests (RATs) and monoplex (RT)‐PCR assays; (B) directly after RATs; (C) as first‐line tests for the detection of viral pathogens. ICU, intensive‐care unit.
